cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles N of the western tip of Cuba and 765 miles SE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, forecast to turn northwest then north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas–southwest Louisiana coast near the TX/LA border (around Sabine Pass – Cameron area)

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch and Storm Surge Watch
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Port Bolivar TX to west of Morgan City LA; Storm Surge Watch: San Luis Pass TX to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Texas coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts, including Sabine Lake and Galveston Bay regions
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (potential 7–11 ft in Sabine Lake area)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (73% chance); hurricane-force gusts possible (48% chance for ≥50 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: 7–11 ft inundation possible along Sabine Lake and lower Neches River channel
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain 4–8 in, isolated 12 in, risk of flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous rip currents and high surf
